taskMan

Class Planning

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.Planning

  • public class Planning
extends java.lang.Object
    A planning contains data essential for the execution of a task. Every task will have an instance of Planning. In this planning everything related to time will be kept (The planned and actual begin time, the end time, the estimated duration and acceptable deviation to this duration). If a task is unplanned, its planning instance will not contain a planned begin time. Obviously it will also lack an actual begin time and end time, since a task cannot begin without being planned first. When a task is planned a list of developers will also be added to the planning. These developers are the developers assigned to the task and are responsible for finishing or failing the task.
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Constructor Detail

      • Planning

        public Planning(int estimatedDuration,
                int acceptableDeviation)
        Construct a new planning instance for a task with an estimated duration and an acceptable deviation to this duration. A new planning instance has not yet been "planned".
        Parameters:
        estimatedDuration - | The estimated duration of the task
        acceptableDeviation - | The acceptable deviation (a percentage) that the actual task's duration is allowed to deviate from the planned one

        Returns:

        public boolean setPlannedBeginTime(java.time.LocalDateTime newPlannedBeginTime)
        Set the planned begin time to a given timestamp
        Parameters:
        newPlannedBeginTime - | The timestamp when the task is meant (planned) to actually begin
        Returns:
        True if the task has been successfully planned, false otherwise

        Set the actual begin time of the task. This can happen only once.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public boolean setEndTime(java.time.LocalDateTime endTime)

        Parameters:
        endTime - | The new end time
        Returns:
        True if the new end time was successfully set, false otherwise

      • getTimeSpent

        public TimeSpan getTimeSpent(java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime,
                             java.time.LocalTime availabilityStart,
                             java.time.LocalTime availabilityEnd)
        Returns the time spent on the task. If the task is still being worked on, this method will return the time in working time elapsed between the start time and current time. If the task has concluded (hasEnded() = true), this method will return the time in working time elapsed between the start- and end time of the task.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - | The current time
        availabilityStart - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        availabilityEnd - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        Returns:
        time spent on this task in working time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the start time of the task is after the time given.

      • getPlannedEndTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getPlannedEndTime(java.time.LocalTime availabilityStart,
                                                 java.time.LocalTime availabilityEnd)
        Based on the planned begin time and the estimated duration, this method will calculate the timestamp when this task is planned to end
        Parameters:
        availabilityStart - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        availabilityEnd - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        Returns:
        the planned end time

      • getAcceptableEndTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime getAcceptableEndTime(java.time.LocalTime availabilityStart,
                                                    java.time.LocalTime availabilityEnd)
        A method to calculate the last possible timestamp when the task should still be considered "on time"
        Parameters:
        availabilityStart - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        availabilityEnd - | A timestamp to indicate the presence of an availability period. Time calculations will be limited by this timestamp
        Returns:
        the last possible acceptable end time
